tweets.html:
@Cmdr_Hadfield Are you tweeting from space? MBB

— William Shatner (@WilliamShatner) January 3, 2013

@WilliamShatner Yes, Standard Orbit, Captain. And we're detecting signs of life on the surface.

— Chris Hadfield (@Cmdr_Hadfield) January 3, 2013

I'm proud of being Canadian, but after yesterday's twitter conversation am starting to question wearing this red shirt. pic.twitter.com/9iss6g0P

— Chris Hadfield (@Cmdr_Hadfield) January 4, 2013

.@Cmdr_Hadfield: I'm fine with beaming down with the away team, as long as I don't have to wear the red shirt.

— George Takei (@GeorgeTakei) January 4, 2013

@Cmdr_Hadfield @WilliamShatner Neil & I would've tweeted from the moon if we could have but I would prefer to tweet from Mars. Maybe by 2040

— Buzz Aldrin (@TheRealBuzz) January 4, 2013

With @GeorgeTakei posting about our space comms, all we need is @TheRealNimoy to beam in and we'd have an away team! :) http://t.co/5DB68Ow7

— Chris Hadfield (@Cmdr_Hadfield) January 4, 2013

@Cmdr_Hadfield. LLAP

— Leonard Nimoy (@TheRealNimoy) January 5, 2013

I am not Spock either, but living and working in this spaceship comes pretty close. Life mirrors art. LLAP, @therealNimoy.

— Chris Hadfield (@Cmdr_Hadfield) January 5, 2013

tweets.author_name: Wil 'Kick the Nazis off the tweeters' Wheaton
tweets.html:
@Cmdr_Hadfield If you get into trouble with Nanites while you're in orbit, I know a guy who can help you contain them. He has experience.

— Wil 'Kick the Nazis off the tweeters' Wheaton (@wilw) January 5, 2013

@wilw Wesley, we've talked about you being on the bridge. I believe you're needed in Engineering. :)

— Chris Hadfield (@Cmdr_Hadfield) January 5, 2013

I was considering sitting down and drawing all of Doctor Who's greatest enemies but how do you even draw the Bechdel Test?

— Calamity Jon üåπ‚úçÔ∏è (@calamityjon) January 4, 2013

Fun fact: The Jamie Kennedy Experiment was a government initiative to see how quickly a TV show could fade from our collective memory.

— Rob Sheridan (@robertdsheridan) January 5, 2013

That this Tyler Perry OWN show about a family with a maid is referred to as #Downton-like might be evidence #Downton has ruined everything.

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) January 5, 2013

"There's nothing we can do." - My entire spec script for Law & Order: Stolen Bicycles Unit

— Mike Drucker (@MikeDrucker) January 5, 2013

I feel like you could easily trick John Mayer into buying a $300 t-shirt.

— Julius Sharpe (@juliussharpe) January 5, 2013

I wonder if there's a scale for how Goldblum one of Jeff Goldblum's performances is. If so, last night's #Portlandia was on the high end.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) January 5, 2013

Can't hear what's going on in ITV's #Splash over the sound of the world's biggest and most ludicrous ever barrel being scraped

— Owen Jonesüåπ (@OwenJones84) January 5, 2013

This is literally the worst Saturday night show of all time. And yet I can't turn it off. #splash

— Heidi Stephens (@heidistephens) January 5, 2013

Idea for ITV show: OARS: Minor celebs row slowly up a river on a Saturday night. We watch.

— James Cary (@sitcomgeek) January 5, 2013

It's Saturday night and I'm watching Mrs Miggins from Blackadder bellyflop off a 5m board. #Splash

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) January 5, 2013

oh god #splash

— Grace Dent (@gracedent) January 5, 2013

At first, i couldn't look. Now I can't stop looking. #splash

— James Cary (@sitcomgeek) January 5, 2013

I've just turned onto ITV: Sweet baby cheeses, WHAT IS GOING ON?! #splashtag

— Sarah Murray (@MrsJohnLocke) January 5, 2013

#Splash becomes interactive if you throw a cup of water into your own face when the celebs hit the pool.

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) January 5, 2013

Next on ITV1, Splat! It's like #splash but without the water

— Tim Glanfield‚Ñ¢ (@timglanfield) January 5, 2013

FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, NOBODY VOTE. IT'S A TRAP #splashtag

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) January 5, 2013

Everone who is desperate enough to vote should have their address published on daily mail website. #splash

— John Mather Photog (@John_Mather) January 5, 2013

We need somebody to either chicken out of their dive, or REALLY hurt themselves for #Splash to turn itself around.

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) January 5, 2013

When a celeb gets voted off, do we get a compilation of "their wet bits". #Splash

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) January 5, 2013

What a strange programme #Splash

— LV (@LisaVen) January 5, 2013

Have they put that special chemical in the water, so we can tell which celeb wet themselves on the way down? #Splash

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) January 5, 2013

ITV can save #Splash by scheduling a #DowntonAbbey special very soon. I'd pay money to see Carson and the Dowager Countess dive off the 10m.

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) January 5, 2013

If you think Splash is weird you should watch the original Dutch version!

— Ian Wylie (@ianwylie) January 5, 2013

#Splash! is being bashed left, right and centre. But I KNOW it is not the worst TV show I will watch this year. That's waiting for me...

— Lorna Cooper (@Coops_tv) January 5, 2013

Fuck. That was... I can't... My god. Fuck. #splashtag

— Stuart Heritage (@stuheritage) January 5, 2013

I missed the end of Splash! Went to the pub instead. Did it suddenly transform into quality television?

— Heidi Stephens (@heidistephens) January 5, 2013

@heidistephens The pool accidentally drained and Omid Djalili fell to his death.

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) January 5, 2013

Hey TV writers, established and aspiring, what if we all came together & made a pact to stop using the phrase "man cave" in our scripts?

— pilot (@pilotbacon) January 5, 2013

Ladies of SMASH, please close your mouths: http://t.co/7oBFBMZq

— Kelli Marshall (@KelliMarshall) January 5, 2013

Oscar Buzz: I'm the front runner in the category "Person When Asked How Many Twitter Followers He Has Convincingly Pretends Not To Know."

— Danny Zuker (@DannyZuker) January 6, 2013

Watching real love on shows like The Bachelor makes me realize my own marriage is a fake bucket of shit.

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) January 6, 2013

a James Caan love scene...is that considered sex or violence? #Starz #MagicCity #TCA2013

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) January 5, 2013

Unofficial #TCA13 "girdle" count: 1 (Kelly Lynch)

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) January 5, 2013

I am now being told that Jenny McCarthy represents my gender and how we talk about pop culture. ::Starts silently weeping:: #TCA13

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) January 6, 2013

Jenny "Shits-A-Lot" McCarthy is about to take the stage. #TCA13

— Matt Fowler (@TheMattFowler) January 6, 2013

You may not realize this, but Jenny McCarthy is *still* playing Jenny McCarthy. Interesting idea.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 6, 2013

"What is missing in late night, to me, is a bit of sexiness!" Jenny McCarthy has clearly never seen the revamped Nightline. #tca13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) January 6, 2013

"I could have totally rocked daytime," says Jenny McCarthy. Hm. #TCA13

— Philiana (@insidethetube) January 6, 2013

$10 to any critic at #TCA13 who asks Jenny McCarthy if what late night needs is criminally irresponsible denial of scientific reality.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) January 6, 2013

To keep myself sane during this segment, I'm imagining how Barbara Stanwyck would deal with Jenny McCarthy. #TCA13

— Alyssa Rosenberg (@AlyssaRosenberg) January 6, 2013

This Jenny McCarthy session has now become surreal. It's just too long of a story to explain it.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 6, 2013

Jenny McCarthy's new show, debuting in a month, still has no set look, isn't sure where it will find guests. #recipeforsuccess #tca13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) January 6, 2013

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
Jenny McCarthy clogs toilets, burns down hotel rooms and has no idea what her show will be was my takeaway today. #TCA13

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) January 6, 2013

Their most successful show is Love and Hip Hop: Atlanta. How does Jenny McCarthy appeal to that audience, precisely? #TCA13

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) January 6, 2013

@Memles black folks like foolywang. #imfinallyademographic

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) January 6, 2013

Who could've guessed that Jenny McCarthy'd be more responsible for facilitating disease transmission after hosting Singled Out than during?

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) January 6, 2013

Next up: Dog the Bounty Hunter! Viacom is just a rainbow of assholes today. #tca13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) January 6, 2013

Dog just somehow worked the Newtown massacre into an answer about the epidemic of poorly trained bounty hunters. #what? #tca13

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) January 6, 2013

bummer thought: my hair will never be as long or blonde as Dog the Bounty Hunter's.

— Diane Gordon (@thesurfreport) January 6, 2013

#TCA13 drinking game corollary: Drink every time an exec talks about how "social" a show is.

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) January 6, 2013

Dog thre Bounty Hunter and CMT following Jenny McCarthy was my TCA Day 2 tipping point. Back in room, weeping.

— Tim Goodman (@BastardMachine) January 6, 2013

"I really didn't expect to be back in the reality genre after 'Leave it to Lamas.'" Lorenzo says. You and me both, brother. #tca13

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) January 6, 2013

I makes me sad that "Leave it to Lamas" existed, but "Leave it to Llamas" didn't. #TCA13

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 6, 2013

tweets.author_name: Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas
tweets.html:
Some of my jokes would work better if life were Arrested Development and I could have hilariously appropriate flashbacks at key moments.

— Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas (@spooloflies) January 6, 2013

Has NBC considered also replacing Christina Applegate and Will Arnett on "Up All Night"? Just in case...

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) January 6, 2013

Black, white athletes? Check. Corporate sponsors? Check. Country music? Check. Blonde with legs, military reference? NBC has it all covered

— Full Dissident (@hbryant42) January 6, 2013

Adrian Peterson is the second hardest runner I have ever seen after Kool-Aid.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) January 6, 2013

I liked Joe Webb a lot more on Dragnet

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) January 6, 2013

It was okay, but it falls apart at the end. RT: @hodgman Don't mean to brag, but I just got a review copy of Lego Downton Abbey

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) January 6, 2013

Based on my enjoyment of "Scandal", @netflix thinks I'll enjoy TV shows that are absolutely nothing like it but star African Americans.

— Sarah Watson (@SarahWatson42) January 6, 2013

If Smash wants me to believe Katharine McPhee is a world-class actress and singer, it needs to stop casting others who are better at both.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) January 6, 2013

Why has there never been a woman in Spongebob's life?

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) January 6, 2013

@MeLectable @Crutnacker C'mon! Sandy Cheeks to Spongebob is like Cybill Shepherd to Bruce Willis in "Moonlighting" right? Right? *crickets*

— Jeffrey Bouley (@thedeaconblue) January 6, 2013

& I hope every writer treats every assignment with 100% commitment. If I'm doing The Fall Guy, it's gonna be the best version I can imagine.

— Zack Stentz (@MuseZack) January 6, 2013

We are never ever ever ever getting back together.

— Perd Hapley (@PerdHapley) January 6, 2013

The commercials for investigative reporters on local TV make you want to root for corrupt business people.

— Crutnacker (@Crutnacker) January 6, 2013

Does bourbon make Justified better, or does Justified make bourbon better?

— brian (@AdmiraltyPirate) January 6, 2013

Steven Seagal looks like Wayne Newton if Wayne Newton had seen some shit.

— Vanessa Ramos (@thatRamosgirl) January 6, 2013

I really like FX. Then I'm reminded there are 90 episodes of Anger Management forthcoming and I like them less.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) January 6, 2013

Living in the East Village is nothing like 'Rent' except that if Jesse L Martin burst into my apt with vodka and cigarettes I'd sing too.

— Richard Lawson (@rilaws) January 6, 2013

The British could have easily won the Revolutionary War if they had been able to threaten us with Downton Abbey spoilers.

— Frank Conniff (@FrankConniff) January 6, 2013

We're three years past The Prisoner remake airing on AMC and I still don't get it

— Jason Wojciechowski (@jlwoj) January 6, 2013

Aughhhhh this is all getting deleted in the morning but I hate that I'm attracted to Ray Romano.

— Julieanne Smolinski (@BoobsRadley) January 6, 2013

My phone is always at 32% batt life it's never explained like how the island cured Rose's cancer on LOST

— Chelsea Peretti (@chelseaperetti) January 6, 2013

I made a data visualization of every episode of West Wing. #mla13 http://t.co/pmn2CUCi

— Mark Sample (@samplereality) January 6, 2013

Truly concerned that when LA industry people get back tomorrow after their 3 week break they won't remember how to ignore calls or brownnose

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) January 6, 2013

It took NHLPA 13 more days to reach a deal than it took the WGA. Those residual fees on 'Rock'em Sock'em Hockey' DVDs must be pesky.

— Brent Piaskoski (@BrentPiaskoski) January 6, 2013

America is still the greatest country in the world to die of a heart attack in an Arby's drive-thru while on your way to see JACK REACHER.

— Will Tracy (@williamtracy) January 6, 2013

I bet Donald Trump pays a guy just to brief him on the day's wind direction so his hair doesn't stage a violent mutiny.
